在小贩中心（Hawker centre）用餐是新加坡和马来西亚特有饮食文化，偌大的空间内隔成不少的摊位，在同一空间内可吃到即平价亦 …

于是小贩美食中心（Hawker Center）便应运而生，成为新加坡人的日常必需品。其实就是和上海的大食代一个风格的廉价美食中心， …

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: probably from Low German or Dutch and related to huckster

entry.def: You can use hawker to refer to a person who tries to sell things by calling at people's homes or standing in the street, especially when you do not approve of this activity.

example.ex: ...as soon as she saw that it was a visitor and not a hawker or tramp at her door.
example.tran: 她一看到门口站着的是位访客而不是街头小贩或流浪汉…

means.word_mean: 1. someone who travels about selling his wares (as on the streets or at carnivals)
2. a person who breeds and trains hawks and who follows the sport of falconry
